metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: CSS Flex Container
The CSS Flex Container
Like we specified in the previous chapter, this is a flex container (the blue area) with three flex items :
content.html: Like we specified in the previous chapter, this is a flex container (the blue area) with three flex items:

content.text: The flex container becomes flexible by setting the display property to flex :
content.html: The flex container becomes flexible by setting the display property to flex:

content.code_html:
.flex-container {
  display: flex;
}

content.text: The CSS properties we use for the flex container are:
content.html: The CSS properties we use for the flex container are:

content.text: The CSS flex-direction Property
The flex-direction property specifies the display-direction of flex items in the flex container.
content.html: The flex-direction property specifies the display-direction of flex items in the flex container.

content.text: The flex-direction property can have one of the following values:
content.html: The flex-direction property can have one of the following values:

content.code_html:
.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row-reverse;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column-reverse;
}

content.text: The CSS flex-wrap Property
The flex-wrap property specifies whether the flex items should wrap or not, if there is not enough room for them on one flex line.
content.html: The flex-wrap property specifies whether the flex items should wrap or not, if there is not enough room for them on one flex line.

content.text: The flex-wrap property can have one of the following values:
content.html: The flex-wrap property can have one of the following values:

content.code_html:
.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  flex-wrap: nowrap;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  flex-wrap: wrap-reverse;
}

content.text: The CSS flex-flow Property
The flex-flow property is a shorthand property for setting both the flex-direction and flex-wrap properties.
content.html: The flex-flow property is a shorthand property for setting both the flex-direction and flex-wrap properties.

content.code_html:
.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  flex-flow: row wrap;
}

content.text: The CSS justify-content Property
The justify-content property is used to align the flex items when they do not use all available space on the main-axis (horizontally).
content.html: The justify-content property is used to align the flex items when they do not use all available space on the main-axis (horizontally).

content.text: The justify-content property can have one of the following values:
content.html: The justify-content property can have one of the following values:

content.code_html:
.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  justify-content: center;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  justify-content: flex-start;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  justify-content: flex-end;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  justify-content: space-around;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  justify-content: space-between;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  justify-content: space-evenly;
}

content.text: The CSS align-items Property
The align-items property is used to align the flex items when they do not use all available space on the cross-axis (vertically).
content.html: The align-items property is used to align the flex items when they do not use all available space on the cross-axis (vertically).

content.text: The align-items property can have one of the following values:
content.html: The align-items property can have one of the following values:

content.text: In the following examples we use a 200 pixels high container, to better demonstrate the align-items property.
content.html: In the following examples we use a 200 pixels high container, to better demonstrate the align-items property.

content.code_html:
.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  height: 200px;
  align-items: center;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  height: 200px;
  align-items: flex-start;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  height: 200px;
  align-items: flex-end;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  height: 200px;
  align-items: stretch;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  height: 200px;
  align-items: baseline;
}

content.text: The CSS align-content Property
The align-content property is used to align the flex lines.
content.html: The align-content property is used to align the flex lines.

content.text: The align-content property is similar to align-items , but instead of aligning flex items, it aligns the flex lines.
content.html: The align-content property is similar to align-items, but instead of aligning flex items, it aligns the flex lines.

content.text: The align-content property can have one of the following values:
content.html: The align-content property can have one of the following values:

content.text: In the following examples we use a 600 pixels high container, with the flex-wrap property set to wrap , to better demonstrate the align-content property.
content.html: In the following examples we use a 600 pixels high container, with the flex-wrap property set to wrap, to better demonstrate the align-content property.

content.code_html:
.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  height: 600px;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  align-content: center;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  height: 600px;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  align-content: stretch;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  height: 600px;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  align-content: flex-start;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  height: 600px;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  align-content: flex-end;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  height: 600px;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  align-content: space-between;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  height: 600px;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  align-content: space-around;
}

.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  height: 600px;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  align-content: space-evenly;
}

content.text: Perfect Centering
In the following example we will solve a common style problem: perfect centering.
content.html: In the following example we will solve a common style problem: perfect centering.

content.text: SOLUTION: Set both the justify-content and align-items properties to center , and the flex item will be perfectly centered:
content.html: SOLUTION: Set both the justify-content and align-items properties to center, and the flex item will be perfectly centered:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
.flex-container {  display: flex;  height: 300px;  justify-content: 
  center;  align-items: center;}

display: flex;  height: 300px;  justify-content: 
  center;  align-items: center;

content.code:
.flex-container {  display: flex;  height: 300px;  justify-content:
center;  align-items: center;}

syntax_highlighting.text:
.flex-container {  display: flex;  height: 300px;  justify-content: 
  center;  align-items: center;}

display: flex;  height: 300px;  justify-content: 
  center;  align-items: center;

content.code_html:
.flex-container {
  display: flex;
  height: 300px;
  justify-content: center;
  align-items: center;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
.flex-container {  display: flex;  height: 300px;  justify-content: 
  center;  align-items: center;}

display: flex;  height: 300px;  justify-content: 
  center;  align-items: center;

content.text: The CSS Flex Container Properties
The following table lists all the CSS Flex Container properties:
content.html: The following table lists all the CSS Flex Container properties:

content.code_html:
Property Description
align-content Modifies the behavior of the flex-wrap property. It is similar to align-items, but instead of aligning flex items, it aligns flex lines
align-items Vertically aligns the flex items when the items do not use all available space on the cross-axis
display Specifies the display behavior (the type of rendering box) for an element
flex-direction Specifies the direction of the flex items inside a flex container
flex-flow A shorthand property for flex-direction and flex-wrap
flex-wrap Specifies whether the flex items should wrap or not, if there is not enough room for them on one flex line
justify-content Horizontally aligns the flex items when the items do not use all available space on the main-axis
